sen.j: タカナ（高菜、学名：Brassica juncea var. integlifolia）とはアブラナ科の越年草で、カラシナの変種。
sen.e: Takana (scientific name: Brassica juncea var. integlifolia) is a biennial grass belonging to brassica family, and a variety of leaf mustard.
Takana (scientific name: Brassica juncea var. integlifolia) is a biennial grass belonging to brassica family, and a variety of Brassica juncea.
sen.cmt: a variety of leaf mustard をa variety of Brassica juncea に修正しました。
sen.e: Takana (scientific name: Brassica juncea var. integlifolia) is a biennial grass belonging to brassica family, and a variety of Brassica juncea.

sen.j: 20～60cmほどの丈に成長する。
sen.e: It grows approximately 20 to 60 cm in length.
It grows approximately 20 to 60 cm in length.
It grows approximately 20 to 60 cm in length.

sen.j: 原産地は不明であるが、日本には平安時代に中国から入ってきたといわれている。
sen.e: The place of origin is unknown, but it is said that it came to Japan from China in the Heian period.
The place of origin is unknown, but it is said that it came to Japan from China in the Heian period.
The place of origin is unknown, but it is said that it came to Japan from China in the Heian period.

sen.j: 近縁の野菜としてコマツナ、カツオナなどが知られる。
sen.e: Komatsuna and katsuona are known as its related vegetables.
Komatsuna and katsuona are known as its related vegetables.
Komatsuna and katsuona are known as its related vegetables.

sen.j: 西日本一帯で広く栽培される。
sen.e: It is grown widely in western Japan.
It is grown widely in western Japan.
It is grown widely in western Japan.

sen.j: 江戸菜（えどな）との異称もある。
sen.e: It is also called Edona.
It is also called "Edona."
sen.cmt: Edona にダブルコーテーションを追記しました。
sen.e: It is also called "Edona."

sen.j: 品種や栽培方法によって変化するが、葉や茎は柔らかく辛味がある。
sen.e: Depending on the variety and the cultivation method, its leaf and stem are soft and have pungent taste.
Depending on the variety and the cultivation method, its leaf and stem are soft and have pungent taste.
Depending on the variety and the cultivation method, its leaf and stem are soft and have pungent taste.

sen.j: 辛みの成分はマスタードなどと同じイソチオシアン酸アリル。
sen.e: The pungent component is allyl isosulfocyanate, the same as that of mustard.
The pungent component is allyl isosulfocyanate, the same as that of mustard.
The pungent component is allyl isosulfocyanate, the same as that of mustard.

sen.j: 主に漬け物として食用される。
sen.e: It is eaten mostly as pickles.
It is eaten mostly as pickles.
It is eaten mostly as pickles.

sen.j: 特に、熊本県阿蘇山での栽培が盛んで、この地域の食べ方は名物となっている。
sen.e: Mt. Aso, Kumamoto Prefecture, in particular, is richly cultivated with takana, and famous for its own way of eating it.
Mt. Aso, Kumamoto Prefecture, in particular, is richly cultivated with takana, and famous for its own way of eating it.
Mt. Aso, Kumamoto Prefecture, in particular, is richly cultivated with takana, and famous for its own way of eating it.

sen.j: 平安時代の「和名抄」に「タカナ」の記述が見られるため、それ以前に日本に伝来していたと思われる。
sen.e: Since the description of "takana" was found in the "Wamyo-sho (a dictionary)" compiled in the Heian period, it seems to have come to Japan before the period.
Since the description of 'takana' was found in the 'Wamyo-sho' (a dictionary) compiled in the Heian period, it seems to have come to Japan before then.
sen.cmt: ダブルコーテーションをシングルコーテーションに修正しました。before the period を before then に修正しました。
sen.e: Since the description of 'takana' was found in the 'Wamyo-sho' (a dictionary) compiled in the Heian period, it seems to have come to Japan before then.

sen.j: 高菜漬として塩漬けにし乳酸発酵させて食べる。
sen.e: It is eaten as takanazuke (pickled takana) made by pickling takana in salt and fermenting it by lactic acid bacterium.
It is eaten as takanazuke (pickled takana) made by pickling takana in salt and fermenting it by lactic acid bacterium.
It is eaten as takanazuke (pickled takana) made by pickling takana in salt and fermenting it by lactic acid bacterium.

sen.j: 近年では発酵させず調味液で浅漬けにしたものも人気である。
sen.e: Takana lightly soaked in liquid preparation without fermentation is popular in recent years.
Takana lightly soaked in liquid preparation without fermentation is popular in recent years.
Takana lightly soaked in liquid preparation without fermentation is popular in recent years.

sen.j: 後者は「新高菜漬」とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: This is called "Shin (New) takanazuke".
The latter one is also called "Shin (New) takanazuke."
The latter one is also called "Shin (New) takanazuke."

sen.j: 主にどちらも細かく刻んだのち、好みにより醤油をたらして食べる。
sen.e: In the both cases, it is eaten with soy sauce dropped on it if desired, after cut in little pieces.
In the both cases, it is eaten with soy sauce dropped on it if desired, after cut into little pieces.
sen.cmt: in を into に修正しました。
sen.e: In the both cases, it is eaten with soy sauce dropped on it if desired, after cut into little pieces.

sen.j: 細かく刻んだ状態で売られていることも多い。
sen.e: In many cases, finely-shred takanazuke is sold.
In many cases, finely-shred takanazuke is sold.
In many cases, finely-shred takanazuke is sold.

sen.j: 高菜漬を油で炒めた「高菜炒め」も美味だが、乳酸発酵させたものを炒めた場合には独特の臭気があり、この匂いを嫌う人も多い。
sen.e: "Takana itame" cooked by stir-frying takanazuke in oil is delicious, but if lactic-fermented takanazuke is fried, it generates a distinctive smell, which some people dislike.
"Takana itame" cooked by stir-frying takanazuke in oil is delicious, but if lactic-fermented takanazuke is fried, it generates a distinctive smell, which some people dislike.
"Takana itame" cooked by stir-frying takanazuke in oil is delicious, but if lactic-fermented takanazuke is fried, it generates a distinctive smell, which some people dislike.

sen.j: その他高菜漬を具材として炒めた高菜チャーハンや、阿蘇名物の高菜めし、その他近畿地方では、刻まずに葉を広げておにぎりを包んだめはりずしも知られる。
sen.e: Other dishes are well known, such as Takana chahan, fried rice with takanazuke as an ingredient, Takana meshi (rice with takanazuke), the specialty of Aso, and Meharizushi, large sushi wrapped in the uncut pickled leaves of takana.

Other dishes are well known, such as Takana chahan, fried rice with takanazuke as an ingredient, Takana meshi (rice with takanazuke), the specialty of Aso, and Meharizushi, large sushi wrapped in the uncut pickled leaves of takana.

Other dishes are well known, such as Takana chahan, fried rice with takanazuke as an ingredient, Takana meshi (rice with takanazuke), the specialty of Aso, and Meharizushi, large sushi wrapped in the uncut pickled leaves of takana.

sen.j: めはりずしは新宮駅の名物駅弁として知られる。
sen.e: The meharizushi is known for ekiben (a box lunch sold on a train or at a station) specific to Shingu Station.
The meharizushi is known for ekiben (a box lunch sold on a train or at a station) specific to Shingu Station.
The meharizushi is known for ekiben (a box lunch sold on a train or at a station) specific to Shingu Station.

sen.j: 唐辛子を加えて同様に漬け込んだ辛子高菜も熊本の名産品として人気がある。
sen.e: Karashi takana made by pickling takana with red peppers is popular for the specialty of Kumamoto.
Karashi takana made by pickling takana with red peppers is popular for the specialty of Kumamoto.
Karashi takana made by pickling takana with red peppers is popular for the specialty of Kumamoto.

sen.j: また明太子を加えて漬け込んだ明太高菜は、博多（福岡県福岡市）の名産品として知られる。
sen.e: Mentai takana made by pickling takana with mentaiko (salted cod roe spiced with red pepper) is known as the specialty of Hakata (Fukuoka City, Fukuoka Prefecture).
Mentai takana made by pickling takana with mentaiko (salted cod roe spiced with red pepper) is known as the specialty of Hakata (Fukuoka City, Fukuoka Prefecture).
Mentai takana made by pickling takana with mentaiko (salted cod roe spiced with red pepper) is known as the specialty of Hakata (Fukuoka City, Fukuoka Prefecture).

sen.j: 博多ラーメン店など福岡県周辺で豚骨ラーメンを提供する店は、お好みでラーメンにトッピングできる唐辛子を利かせた油いための高菜漬を用意している店も多い。
sen.e: Many shops offering tonkotsu ramen (noodle with a thick broth made from boiling pork bones) including Hakata ramen shops prepare takanazuke stir-fried in oil with red pepper to top ramen with.
Many shops offering tonkotsu ramen (noodle with a thick broth made from boiling pork bones) including Hakata ramen shops prepare takanazuke stir-fried in oil with red pepper to top ramen with.
Many shops offering tonkotsu ramen (noodle with a thick broth made from boiling pork bones) including Hakata ramen shops prepare takanazuke stir-fried in oil with red pepper to top ramen with.

sen.j: 唐辛子と油と高菜の味が調味になる。
sen.e: Ramen is seasoned with the combined taste of red pepper, oil and takana.
Ramen is seasoned with the combined taste of red pepper, oil and takana.
Ramen is seasoned with the combined taste of red pepper, oil and takana.

sen.j: コンビニにも高菜漬のおにぎりが売られているが､酢飯の入った物が売っている場合もある。
sen.e: Convenience stores sell rice balls with takanazuke, and vinegared rice is used for some rice balls.
Convenience stores sell rice balls with takanazuke, and vinegared rice is used for some rice balls.
